messages.message:
In the monorepo, which codebase is master expected to track?

1. The current release-23.04 or the future release-23.07 ?
2. If we are tracking latest code which is supposed to be cut into 23.07 then how do we backport changes/fixes to 23.04?
    a. Do we backport to 23.04 via master? (or)
    b. Directly create a PR for release-23.04 branch?

1. master is supposed to be 23.07, I think we haven't yet bump the version in RELEASE_VERSION (currently it remains 23.05 which is bumped when we did the 23.04 code cut)
2. you should make the change to master and then follow this wiki  (https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENG/pages/1811447809/Guide+to+Backports+Cherry-picks)to get it backported
If i have a fix which is only required for 23.04 or 23.01 and dont want it to go to 23.07 or any future releases, then what is the method to backport ?

Read through the wiki, looks like this case is not covered.

When is it ok to create a PR directly to a release-x.x.x branch?
any conventions to follow for the same ? like tags, descriptions etc.
yeah in that case you can create a PR target the release branch directly, and add backport-check-skip label to the PR so it will skip the completeness check
